text:
The nature of SEO is VUCA.

VUCA(volatility, uncertainty, complexity, & ambiguity) is an acronym that is used to describe the nature of a challenging situation.

- Volatile: unexpected algorithm updates & daily ranking fluctuations.

- Uncertain: content in the most important ranking factor but the majority of other factors are unknown.

- Complex: interdependent systems(content, optimization, tech) & tasks.

- Ambiguous: 'effort vs impact' not straight forward.

Because of this, do you think working in SEO has made your thinking more nuanced/ make better decisions?

elements.text:
The nature of SEO is VUCA.

VUCA(volatility, uncertainty, complexity, & ambiguity) is an acronym that is used to describe the nature of a challenging situation.

- Volatile: unexpected algorithm updates & daily ranking fluctuations.

- Uncertain: content in the most important ranking factor but the majority of other factors are unknown.

- Complex: interdependent systems(content, optimization, tech) & tasks.

- Ambiguous: 'effort vs impact' not straight forward.

Because of this, do you think working in SEO has made your thinking more nuanced/ make better decisions?

text: This is kind of a difficult question! I would say working with SEO (I focus more on content creation but work very closely with SEO specialists and incorporate SEO principles into the writing I oversee) has forced me to think about how content is delivered beyond one touchpoint with a reader. It has made me accept, at times even embrace, the fact that we now have "gatekeepers" and curators of content that writers have to acknowledge, understand, and write for. Though, in some ways, working with SEO has challenged me to not necessarily make better decisions, but make harder decisions. Especially when it comes to creating content for purpose and quality vs. matching an algorithm to be seen. So I've definitely learned and continue to learn a lot.
